column9: Colchicine caused severe vomiting and diarrhea. On refelction I would have rather have dealt with the pain -  the pain was horrendous. Allopurinol has done the business for me. I wouldnt recommend colchicine to my worst enemy.

column9: I have chronic gout & this medicine caused severe vomiting & diarreah. I thought I was going to die. I would have rather dealt with the pain, and the pain is horrible! I nearly broke my ribs from dry heaving while vomiting.

column1: Chronic Inflammation of the Joints due to Gout
column2: goutsgotme, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My family has a history of the gout, my grandfather, father, uncles, and myself all take this medication when a flare up does occur. It takes a day for the pain and inflammation to fade away, but it does work great. The only side effect that I get, only when I take more than I am prescribed by the doctor, is a severe case of diarrhea. I do reccommend this drug to anyone who does suffer from it though.

column9: I took this with a severe case of gout. It really took the gout away but the side effects of stomach and diarhhea are brutal. Still, when I have a really bad attack I'll take it again becasue it works.
